children.subject:
I don't know that I'm qualified to give you advice on whether or not to take it, but if you do, I would recommend paying close attention to the piazza and looking for group members as soon as the "search for teammates" post is available. That was my strategy for avoiding people who are prone to procrastination, and it worked out pretty well for me, though I can't say how much of that was luck. The autograder gives some statistics about other groups and from that I could see that many other groups procrastinated quite a bit.

Also, though, definitely think about whether or not you really want to have a semester where you only take one technical course. Being a Berkeley student is an amazing opportunity and you don't want to leave feeling like you didn't take full advantage of it. And if you're going to take 162 with another technical, 168 is said to be one of the lighter ones (though I haven't taken it yet).

history.content:
I took 168 last Fall with Shenker, and honestly it was the lightest-workload CS class I've taken here at Cal (and for reference, I've also taken CS 61ABC/70/164/186/152/161/162). If Shenker gives the same amount of work that he did last Fall, you can expect 1 midterm, a final, and three networking-related python programming projects (each of which is probably shorter than most other CS projects you've completed by now). That being said, I wouldn't worry about 168, if you were at all worried about it in the first place.

Regarding 162, I completely agree with the reply below. I too joined a group of "randoms" at the beginning of the semester, and I ended up with a group of students who were on top of everything and didn't procrastinate. Whether this was luck, or due to searching for a group early on, I'm not sure, but it probably can't hurt to start searching as early as possible. If you can find a group of students who like to start projects early and who do their fair share of each project, the workload of 162 is actually very manageable.

Best of luck with your classes and internship search next semester :)

I'm interested in the material, but I'm aware that the workload is demanding and projects are done in groups. However, no one I know is taking it this fall, so I'll have to rely on a random project group. I'm also taking 168 and a breadth course, in addition to applying for internships for the first time, which I heard takes time in the fall. My alternative will be taking EE120 instead of 162 and leaving 162 for a semester where I can take it as my only technical course.
Any advice is much appreciated.
history.subject: Should I take CS162 this Fall?
